# contentsTransform

**Instance Property**

The transformation applied to the material property’s visual contents. Animatable.

## Declaration

```swift
var contentsTransform: SCNMatrix4 { get set }
```

```swift
var contentsTransform: SCNMatrix4 { get set }
```

## Discussion

SceneKit applies this transformation to the texture coordinates provided by the geometry object the material is attached to, then uses the resulting coordinates to map the material property’s [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNMaterialProperty/contents] across the surface of the material. (This transformation has no effect if the material property’s [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNMaterialProperty/contents] object is a constant color.)

For example, you can use this property to grow, offset, or rotate a texture relative to the surface of a material, as illustrated below.



You can animate changes to this property’s value. See [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/animating-scenekit-content].

## Configuring Texture Mapping Attributes

- **wrapS**: The wrapping behavior for the S texture coordinate.
- **wrapT**: The wrapping behavior for the T texture coordinate.
- **SCNWrapMode**: Modes to apply to texture wrapping, used by the [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNMaterialProperty/wrapT] and [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNMaterialProperty/wrapS] properties.
- **minificationFilter**: Texture filtering for rendering the material property’s image contents at a size smaller than that of the original image.
- **magnificationFilter**: Texture filtering for rendering the material property’s image contents at a size larger than that of the original image.
- **mipFilter**: Texture filtering for using mipmaps to render the material property’s image contents at a size smaller than that of the original image.
- **SCNFilterMode**: Texture filtering modes, used by the [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNMaterialProperty/minificationFilter], [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNMaterialProperty/magnificationFilter], and [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNMaterialProperty/mipFilter] properties.
- **maxAnisotropy**: The amount of anisotropic texture filtering to be used when rendering the material property’s image contents.
- **mappingChannel**: The source of texture coordinates for mapping the material property’s image contents.
- **borderColor**: A color used to fill in areas of a material’s surface not covered by the material property’s image contents.
